alert.note: Alert for Hampshire; Hardy (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 6:04PM EST until January 29 at 1:17PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Baltimore MD/Washington DC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in West Virginia... South Branch Potomac River near Springfield affecting Hampshire and Hardy Counties. For the South Branch Potomac River...including Franklin, Moorefield - SF, Petersburg, Springfield...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Branch Potomac River near Springfield. * WHEN...From Monday morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Milleson Mill Road (County Route 28/5) and Clarence Taylor Road (Route 3/7) begin to flood. Water covers a significant portion of meadowlands near the river. The boat launch ramp on the upstream right abutment of the bridge also floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM EST Sunday the stage was 8.6 feet, or 6.4 feet below flood stage. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 15.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.1 feet on 02/24/2003. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Mon Mon Mon Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 1AM 7AM 1PM Stg Time Date South Branch Potomac River Springfield 15.0 8.6 Sun 5 pm 14.0 15.1 12.9 15.1 7am Mon &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 615 AM EST.
